basics.name: Phil Legg
basics.summary: A Computer Scientist by trade, and a tech enthusiast for as far back as I can remember (since getting my hands on a BBC Micro B and my Dad's subscription to the Micro User magazine...!)

work.name: University of the West of England (UWE Bristol)
work.summary: School of Computing and Creative Technologies
highlights: Full Professor in Cyber Security in recognition of 'Advancing Teaching and Learning' (primary domain) and for 'Research with Impact' (secondary domain).

Co-Director of UWEcyber 'Gold' NCSC Academic Centre of Excellence in Cyber Security Education (ACE-CSE) (2020-present) that brings together teaching, research, outreach and knowledge exchange in Cyber Security, with a multi-disciplinary perspective involving staff across the entire University, a regional network of educators, and a regular guest speaker seminar series that has attracted presenters from across the globe.

Former Programme Leader of the NCSC-Certified MSc Cyber Security (2018-2024), having grown the programme from its initial run of 13 students to as many as 150 students across two intakes in an academic year, and achieving a PTES overall student satisfaction score of 92% (2024).
Programme Leadership Team for BSc Cyber Security and Digital Forensics (2024-), with a focus on industry partnership through guest speakers and industry collaboration with teaching.

Cyber Security Research Theme Lead for the Computer Science Research Centre (2019-present), supporting academic staff and PhD researchers to develop cyber security research across infrastructure security, software security, AI/data security, and cyber crime domains.
Experienced in attracting successful research grant income with over £2.1M directed awarded from external funding sources, and over £3.7M in total (see projects page for futher details).
Published over 70 academic articles in high-quality journals and conference venues (see publications page for further details).
Experience of supervising PhD students to completion, as well as hosting post-doctoral research fellows (see projects page for further details).
Experience of leading outreach initiatives and upskilling educators and industry professionals in cyber security (see teaching page for further details).

work.name: Freelance
highlights: Desktop and Mobile (iOS, Android, Blackberry) development.

Over 40,000 paid downloads on the iOS App Store worldwide since July 2011, with Tide Times being recognised in the Stuff magazine '200 best apps of all time', and also achieving #1 in the 'Top Paid Weather' category (Summer 2011).
PocketCoder used by top sports clubs worldwide including Manchester United FC, Welsh Rugby Union, Ireland RFU, Barnsley FC, Bolton FC, QPR, and the Football Association.
Desktop software includes collaborative development with University Hospital Wales and NHS, producing a 3D stereoscopic imaging system for ophthalmic clinical assessment based on PhD research.
Proficient in variety of development languages: Python, Javascript, Java, C++, C#, Objective-C, Swift.
